html: In a country we say is the greatest country in the world, my God, you ought to be able to go to school. Go to church. Go to synagogue. Go to a concert. Go to a movie theater. Go to a nightclub And not have to worry about someone walking in with a gun.pic.twitter.com/8YYZOQDega
text:
In a country we say is the greatest country in the world, my God, you ought to be able to go to school.

Go to church.

Go to synagogue.

Go to a concert.

Go to a movie theater.

Go to a nightclub

And not have to worry about someone walking in with a gun.pic.twitter.com/8YYZOQDega

html: Our hearts go out to the congregants at Chabad of Poway in California, who’ve endured a horrific act at their synagogue during Passover. I also want Orlando’s Jewish community to know that we stand with you against hatred and anti-semitism.
text: Our hearts go out to the congregants at Chabad of Poway in California, who’ve endured a horrific act at their synagogue during Passover. I also want Orlando’s Jewish community to know that we stand with you against hatred and anti-semitism.

html: Horrible to hear of the synagogue shooting in California on the last day of #Passover. Our hearts are with the Chabad community tonight. We must reject the hateful ideologies that led to this attack, and expand our work to keep deadly weapons out of the wrong hands.
text:
Horrible to hear of the synagogue shooting in California on the last day of #Passover.

Our hearts are with the Chabad community tonight.

We must reject the hateful ideologies that led to this attack, and expand our work to keep deadly weapons out of the wrong hands.

html: Rep. Nadler — "The attorney general appears to be waging a media campaign on behalf of President Trump." "Rather than letting the facts of the report speak for themselves, the attorney general is taking unprecedented steps to spin Mueller's nearly two year investigation."
text:
Rep. Nadler —

We must stop white nationalist violence.pic.twitter.com/ZgXLW1uNEY

html: "I don't know what will happen," said King. "We've got some difficult days ahead. But it really doesn't matter with me now, because I've been to the mountaintop." "I may not get there with you. But I want you to know tonight, that we, as a people, will get to the promised land."
text:
"I don't know what will happen," said King. "We've got some difficult days ahead. But it really doesn't matter with me now, because I've been to the mountaintop."

"I may not get there with you. But I want you to know tonight, that we, as a people, will get to the promised land."

html: Dr. King told us this: "Let us rise up tonight with a greater readiness. Let us stand with a greater determination. And let us move on in these powerful days, these days of challenge, to make America what it ought to be. We have an opportunity to make America a better nation."
text: Dr. King told us this: "Let us rise up tonight with a greater readiness. Let us stand with a greater determination. And let us move on in these powerful days, these days of challenge, to make America what it ought to be. We have an opportunity to make America a better nation."

html: Dr. King was shot and killed 51 years ago today. He was in Memphis, working for the right of sanitation workers to be treated with dignity. The night before, he gave his last speech. "The issue is injustice," he said. "We need all of you." We still do. #MLK51pic.twitter.com/3KAJcssv2d

html: Today I had the honor to dedicate the Napoleon "Nap" Ford Post Office Building. Nap Ford shaped Orlando's future as a lifelong educator, civil rights advocate, and elected representative. He helped to elect Orlando's first black commissioner, then joined city government himself.pic.twitter.com/CZKuNChM7G

html: Our hearts break for the victims and their families in New Zealand. This was not random violence. These are victims of hate. This is what happens when ideologies of exclusion and violence are tolerated; when hate is encouraged by those who should know better. We can’t be silent.
text:
Our hearts break for the victims and their families in New Zealand. This was not random violence. These are victims of hate.

This is what happens when ideologies of exclusion and violence are tolerated; when hate is encouraged by those who should know better. We can’t be silent.

html: Many people don't know that no federal law bans anti-LGBTQ discrimination. Florida also lacks a nondiscrimination law. That means that LGBTQ people can be fired, evicted, and denied services without cause. America should be about fair treatment. Let's pass the #EqualityAct.
text:
Many people don't know that no federal law bans anti-LGBTQ discrimination. Florida also lacks a nondiscrimination law. That means that LGBTQ people can be fired, evicted, and denied services without cause.

America should be about fair treatment. Let's pass the #EqualityAct.

html: Every American has the right to a secure democracy where their voice matters. text:
Every American has the right to a secure democracy where their voice matters. My new bipartisan legislation with @RepStefanik calls for investigation of Russia's finances so we can cut off funding for attacks against the USA.

I'm proud to announce that it just passed the House.pic.twitter.com/6zsidqEPWl

text: Secretary Nielsen couldn’t answer questions about injured officers, whether asylum laws are being followed correctly, how many children are imprisoned by the administration, or the traumatic impact of child separation. Or maybe she knew there was no defense for the indefensible.

html: I was also deeply disappointed that Secretary Nielsen was not able to answer my simple question about how many of her officers had been seriously injured on her watch—despite the fact that I have asked about this before. She’s supposed to be their advocate and representative.

html: Wrote one internment camp detainee, “I believe in this nation's institutions, ideals and traditions. I glory in her heritage. I boast of her history. I trust in her future.” So do I. But only if we learn from the mistakes of the past can we create a future for all of us.pic.twitter.com/7l2Mkmn76p
text:
Wrote one internment camp detainee,

“I believe in this nation's
institutions, ideals and traditions.
I glory in her heritage.
I boast of her history.
I trust in her future.”

So do I. But only if we learn from the mistakes of the past can we create a future for all of us.pic.twitter.com/7l2Mkmn76p

html: Daniel Inouye won the Medal of Honor in World War II. After the war, he was elected to the Senate and became the highest-ranking Asian-American in U.S. history. He said, “The lessons learned must remain as a grave reminder of what we must not allow to happen again to any group.”pic.twitter.com/AWvi49CZAk
text:
Daniel Inouye won the Medal of Honor in World War II. After the war, he was elected to the Senate and became the highest-ranking Asian-American in U.S. history.

He said, “The lessons learned must remain as a grave reminder of what we must not allow to happen again to any group.”pic.twitter.com/AWvi49CZAk
